website_summaries.verdict: A versatile scanner that's extremely easy to operate in different environments.
pros: Scans color documents at up to 600 dpi
Automatic document feeder (ADF) collapses to save space
Simple controls and good battery life
Works w/Apple and Windows and various mobile device formats

website_summaries.verdict: If you're not in a hurry, the highly portable Apparent Doxie Q scans accurately and without a PC, although the software is somewhat antiquated.
pros: Connects to iOS mobile devices, PCs, and Macs via Wi-Fi
Rechargeable battery with long life per charge
Comes with USB cable, 8GB MiniSD card, and cleaning kit
cons: Can't scan directly to a computer
Converting and saving scans to image or searchable PDF is slow

customer_reviews.title: If you want soemting quick and easy to use - forget Doxie.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for 3 weeks now and was hoping that using it would make me more familiar and happy with it. I am not. I had a Fujitsu Scansnap before and compared to this, the Doxie is in the drak ages. I wish I had spent an extra £40 to replace the old scanner which is far superior and simple to use. I bought this after reading the reviews and tought it I'd give it a try. I wish I hadn't. I have never given a one star review before but I am so disappointed with this scanner. My advice, if you want soemthing quick and easy forget the Doxie. I bitterly regret buting it.
customer_reviews.author: C. J. Hammond

customer_reviews.title: A very positive experience with customer service!
customer_reviews.text: The scanner looks nice, the scanning can be quite fiddly at times so you need to be patient. Support team is very friendly and their online chat is excellent - and the positive experience with them was very friendly and helpful. If you have a large volume of scanning then you need a heavy-duty machine, this machine is suitable for a small workload and its portability is very useful.
customer_reviews.author: MayDay Boy

customer_reviews.title: Very small footprint and does what I need
customer_reviews.text: Feels a bit flimsy but guess to be expected with such a small and portable product. It is true that with wireless, the battery runs down quickly so usb connection is to be preferred. But for the occasional connection from another room to home network this works fine. Shame a sleeve/cover is not provided. Document feeder works fine for 8 or so 100gsm sheets. Software allows for rotation of each image but does not do this automatically for all images in a set.
customer_reviews.author: Gazza

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: This hand held scanner is almost perfect. I have deducted one star because I have to feed one sheet at a time. It's supposed to be able to take 8 sheets at a time. Even feeding sheets in one at at a time, it is a an excellent scanner and it has saved me a lot of time.
customer_reviews.author: Snoopy

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant for home based businesses and travelling execs
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Simple and unlike some extremely expensive competitors Doxie keeps up with OS system changes whether Mac or Windows. Support has been brilliant. The smallest niggle is the time it takes to engage a wifi connection and on a superficial level the dated looking interface between Doxie and my computer. However on a practical level, a must for SoHo businesses. Great value, excellent package!
customer_reviews.author: hopefulagnostic

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the standard use case
customer_reviews.text: Really good setup instructions and does exactly what it promises. Downloadable software very intuitive. It is genuinely easy to go from a pile of papers to a searchable single PDF, which is more or less everybody's main use case. In my case, I bought it for digitizing a massive pile of papers required for an annual farm certification saga. This device appears to have made it if not exactly an enjoyable process but nearly completely removed the pain of "how do I put all these papers on the internet?"
customer_reviews.author: Mikhail Tikilyaynen

customer_reviews.title: Good product recommended.
customer_reviews.text: At first I was a bit concerned about this scanner but after Contacting customer support and using it for a while I am pleased to say it is an excellent product. Customer service is excellent. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Cole

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is exactly what I need - portable, compact and holds multiple pages for scanning. It is also wireless and works well with a Mac and uptodate OS
customer_reviews.author: lisamaxiloulou

customer_reviews.title: Doxie scanner
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant - love the fa ct that I can sit watching the TV and scan anything in - then at a later- more convenient time I can download them and sort them. Grouping items and editing items is very easy
customer_reviews.author: Annt

customer_reviews.title: Works well, great quality images. Sometimes tricky to feed in small photographs
customer_reviews.text: Image quality is great and the auto cropping makes quick work of scanning job large amount so of photos. Only downside was that the shelf that holds the pictures that feeds them through the scanner doesn’t do a great job of feeding it through straight. Sometimes the pictures slip and go through diagonally or off centre
customer_reviews.author: SamK

customer_reviews.title: The Ultimate Portable Scanner
customer_reviews.text: This gadget does what it says on the tin, simply, efficiently and constantly. There is no size, shape or weight of paper that is A4 or under that it cannot scan. I would recommend purchasing the carrying case as this is a precision tool which should be protected when shoved into your bag. I decided to go paperless (as far as is possible!) this year and the Doxie Q has made this so hassle free. And on top of all that it's a cool looking gizmo to have on your desk!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Donnacha O'Driscoll

customer_reviews.title: it’s good quality, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: It arrived within what seemed hours if ordering. it’s good quality, lightweight, easy to install, easy to sync and a child could do it. Very happy indeed
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Sue

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Scanner
customer_reviews.text: To those who may think they have a DOA: The included instructions don't mention that the battery is plastic wrapped. However, the online instructions do. The device will not power on until the battery is unwrapped. Scanner is quick, quiet and easy to use. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: Great device. My only qualm is that when uploading via wifi, the machine shuts off due to "inactivity" so you have to restart the wifi transfer when moving more than a dozen photos. In hindsight I would have gone for the non wifi version and saved a few quid. Otherwise, premium product worth the extra for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: K JP

customer_reviews.title: Excellent piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: Excellent piece of kit. Works as a stand alone unit. Connect to PC or Mac only when you need to import scans. Excellent software too. It just works really well!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M Porter

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product
customer_reviews.text: Doqie Q is easy to use, very portable and gives a quality scan. Wish It would connect to more than one wi fi router at the same time i.e home wifi & work wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Robbins

customer_reviews.title: over priced rubbish
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is total S... it drops out of contact utter utter rubbish
customer_reviews.author: Gary Lester

customer_reviews.title: Essential Towards a Paperless Existence.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Now I can get to my goal of being completely paperless. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Simmonds

customer_reviews.title: Nice personal document scanner
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made, compact, and the sheet feeder is a good improvement over my previous Doxie Go Wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Struggle to set-up even for tech confident people
customer_reviews.text: I had such high hopes for this product having read really positive reviews and having had good chats with the team on the Doxie website. Both myself and my partner are incredibly tech savvy and we just couldn't get the product set up on our network at all, and we didn't want to disconnect from our wifi and join the Doxie wifi every time we wanted to transfer the scans. Such a shame as we really loved the idea of keeping the Doxie in a kitchen drawer, scanning every day and then transferring when we had time. Sadly was not to be.
customer_reviews.author: Nicola Gibb

customer_reviews.title: Product would be good - but seller is worst ever
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scanner, to get rid of my paper.. it looks really good and is very portable. Also enjoy to use it w/o the need of an PC or something need to connect it. Just scan your docs and sync them to your mobile device or PC afterwards. But here comes the BUT.. they just sent me an used device and I am not willing to pay this asked money for an used device. I contacted multiple times the manufacture and Amazon. I always got offered to get an new one as an replacement. But now (months later), I only got this lies in the mails and nothing happened. Definitely would not recommend to buy anything from this manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Kornelius Friesen

customer_reviews.title: trash
customer_reviews.text: I do NOT understand the good reviews on this. The one and only good thing about it is that it is battery powered but that does not out way the fact that the scanner is basically useless. It takes two or three sheets almost every time. Its 8 page capacity is a joke and it is so slow. This is just garbage. The brother ADS-1700 is so far superior and cheaper! I am a mobile notary and need mobility, speed and reliability. Unless you are scanning a single page at a time this is a piece of junk
customer_reviews.author: amber

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding little scanner!
customer_reviews.text: It's small, lightweight, portable, and you can expand the memory with standard SD cards. The main reason I haven't gone paperless in the past is the hassle of scanning receipts and documents on a flatbed scanner, and the poor quality of taking pictures with my phone. Enter the Doxie. It's very portable, folds up small, and you don't need to have it attached to a computer to scan. Sit down on your couch with a handful of receipts and go to work, then download the scans at a later date. Has great scan quality, color and B&W, and limited but good resolution settings. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Phrish

customer_reviews.title: Fast, efficient, quality scanner
customer_reviews.text: I was able to quickly and with great quality , scan over 5,000 photos that were just sitting around taking up room. The device kept up well and nearly scanned them faster then I could feed them. The quality settings at 600 or 300 dpi were exactly what I needed. The item is a highly recommended purchase if you need to scan. The ~literally~ only downside is that I had some old Polaroids that were 1/16" thick and it couldn't handle them.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Strohm

customer_reviews.title: The best things come in small packages!
customer_reviews.text: This tiny scanner is perfect to travel with and use at home if needed. It's very easy to use and connects via wifi or memory card to your laptop to save and email your scans. I recommend this compact scanner. The people at Doxie are also wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Krista Debler Out East Therapy

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but you get a great scanner/software tool
customer_reviews.text: Sure this is a bit pricey; however, the battery life is decent, much more solid than earlier units, and you are really buying this for the incredible software integrations. Firstly, I've owned a number of Doxie's and wasn't please how the power jack would be the first thing to fail - resulting in a brick. So I'm more than pleased that the way that one recharges this unit is through a usb - much stronger in my opinion. These units are worth the high cost due solely to their software actually doing what you'd want it to do. I can't understand why other makers of scanners have such poor software.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Flowers

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly great scanner
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a portable scanner that could scan at the quality of a flat board scanner... This scanner not only achieved that but exceeded.... If you are looking for a potable scanner with quality this is it....
customer_reviews.author: Wayne S.

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for market. Beyond disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted Doxie to work it. Online, it sounds great. IRL, it is a delicate flower - an EXPENSIVE delicate flower at that. The ADF does NOT work and connectivity issues are maddening. While I am generally very patient with technology, especially stuff I believe in, Doxie has pushed the bounds of this patience. It is going back. Very, very disappointing. If something isn't ready for market, DON'T SELL IT!
customer_reviews.author: kozmonaut

customer_reviews.title: Paperless office in a blink.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little scanner. We have a larger office scanned, but it’s so tedious to queue up documents. With this little Doxie I can scan everhthing, connect later, and quickly sort, and save all my files. I took 10 years worth of documents and had us paperless in a few days of working on it in between other tasks. The only issue is that sometimes stacks of papers will not feed, or will feed multiple pages at once. It seems to do best with just a few pages at a time. It says up to 8 pages at once but more than 5 I had trouble. But portability is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Convenient as heck, but pages often slipped in feeder
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, easy to figure out and use, battery and memory capacity good. Wireless feature actually worked. But you have to mind the pages as they are fed. Many times they stuck together, messing up pagination, and slipped diagonally, and there is no way to check quality of scans until you go through the scans on a computer.
customer_reviews.author: Roo

customer_reviews.title: Using this is a little more involved than I expected ...
customer_reviews.text: Using this is a little more involved than I expected. I was hoping there was a setting to connect it to WiFi and automatically send anything it scanned to Evernote (or wherever). Instead, it stores the scans in memory, and then you have to import them on your computer later, and send them to Evernote from there. If I'd known it would take as many steps as any other scanner, I would have chosen something cheaper. Edit: Was contacted by their customer service team, who apologized and offered me a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Hey-La-La

customer_reviews.title: Great little scanner!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Dixie Q! It's portable. It's convenient. Good battrey life when fully charger. It even gives me plenty of options for the way I want to and scan documents. Also, it was a very quick set-up. It took me less the 20 minutes after getting it out of the box, but I am faster than the average person at setting up tech. I also highly recommend getting the case for this scanner. I'm not usually one to buy the bells and whistles with products, but since I carry mine from place to place a lot, I can't imagine not having it. Great little scanner at an affordable price. This scanner has earned my teacher stamp of approval!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Update to original review-Charging port is fragile
customer_reviews.text: Update to my original review. The customer service over at Doxie is AMAZING! After leaving my review with the issues I experienced, I was issued a FULL refund and sent a new scanner. I really appreciated how the company went above and beyond to correct my purchase. I would definitely recommend this product AND this company. The product is great and the customer service is amazing. After a few months of use, everything was working well until the charging port became damaged. It's more fragile then I expected it to be. The female end disappeared into the scanner and I can no longer charge it. I don't think I would buy it again considering how fragile the charging port is.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Shuford

customer_reviews.title: I am NOT giving up !
customer_reviews.text: I have no clue what I am doing! I have this scanner for a yr tried so hard to get it to work. I just have lack of knowledge. I am reading all the reviews and most people love it. Within a couple of weeks or so I will be doing my taxes. Who should I call for help. To learn how to operate this machine. It was so costly for me and I do want it to work. Is there a case you can put this machine in. Thanks everyone. Happy new year.
customer_reviews.author: Nora

customer_reviews.title: I use this ALL the time
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an affordable, easy, portable way to scan - and I LOVE this one. I recommend it all of the time to anyone who is interested. So flexible - I can download the scans to my ipad or computer using the wireless function or to my computer using the USB cord. Everything syncs to the cloud and is available wherever I need it. I love how it handles documents that are front and back - and how you can combine scans into one document. Good buy!
customer_reviews.author: DebWasher

customer_reviews.title: A must have for going paperless!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty amazing. It is easy to sit down with a stack of papers and receipts and convert them into a PDF. The sheet feeder can be finicky at times, but I quickly realized I can leave it closed and just feed everything into the back, and come to find out I get through a stack faster that way so I don't mind at all. The included software is pretty handy, allowing you to "staple" or "unstaple" as needed so you can combine or separate your documents into one or more PDFs. As well, it has pretty robust controls for light touchup of color, contrast, etc., though I rarely have to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Bill P.

customer_reviews.title: Very good but could use some improvements.
customer_reviews.text: Eliminate Direct-WI-FI and use users WI-FI network. Clear-up the confusion on how to switch to the users WI-FI from Direct WI-FI. Allow scanning directly to a computer/tablet/phone without first scanning to the SD card and then importing it from the SD card. The direct scanning should be via the users WI-FI or using a USB connection. Allow changing the scanners IP address.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Wassermann

customer_reviews.title: Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Came on time i had some questions on useing, there help is fantastic. Would like to have it scan to computer file. I do say if looking for a portable scanner this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: readyk

customer_reviews.title: Nearly daily use. I haven't looked back.
customer_reviews.text: Negative comments first: The document feeder, as they all do, will occasionally grab more than one sheet at a time. Software doesn't allow you to change scan resolution after the fact (downgrade) Positive comments: The battery life is really good. The wireless ability works, but it's easier to use the included SD card. The software is wonderful, allowing you to combine, reorder, and separate pages at will. The scanner goes up to 600 dpi. Very nice. Very large files.
customer_reviews.author: EEToolman

customer_reviews.title: it has been a great purchase. After several months
customer_reviews.text: The Doxie Q is a reliable and space saving scanner. I used it to scan hundreds of pieces of paper I stored in a two-drawer file cabinet, save them as searchable PDFs, and get rid of the ugly clunky file cabinet. Used in conjunction with macOS's ability to add your signature to legal documents, it has been a great purchase. After several months, I noticed the charging input was dislodged on the inside of the unit. Doxie support quickly shipped me a brand new replacement and paid for the return shipping on the defective unit. Their support have been superb.
customer_reviews.author: Tweezer

customer_reviews.title: Very flexible to use and has a simple to use app interface - this scanner is a winner in the portable class
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and can be set up to scan without connection to any computer or tablet. The instructions are very easy and the online support is great. The scanning capability is very good. We have previously used a Fujitsu that depended on driver support and the company made it overly difficult when Window version updates happened. I don't see that problem at all in the future with the Doxie Q. The only reason I gave it 4 rather than 5 stars is lack of an android app. The very nice customer service person contacted me directly and said that the company is looking into this based on customer surveys. The personal touch for customer service is very nice indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I didn't open this up right away because I wasn't needing it immediately. It doesn't work when I did open the box to use it. I can't get it to take a charge. I tried the cable that came with it and even one that I already had. Nothing works. I am not sure if the one off switch works because there is no power. Because I didn't open immediately, I now have a $200 paper weight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and very portable! Great for classroom. Business and photos!
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is perfect! It’s easy to use, a great size and though i haven’t needed it - the support seems more than willing to help. I had it up and running in well under 10 minutes! I purchased this to scan old documents for a neighbored association and some old family photos that i wanted on a digital frame. I had over 200 pictures scanned in one evening. I was able to scan more than one document at a time and then easily organize them. I will soon be using it to scan classroom activities to share with parents electronically .I highly recommend this product and i know i would order it agin without hesitation. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for Mac, for the price
customer_reviews.text: I would say that it's nice to use and I like that it works well with Mac. Seem hard to find other scanners/programs that work well with Mac. Slightly better than a manually feed option, but not something you would want to use for a lot of business scans. Great for personal use and to keep me paper free. Great to work with the support team as well.
customer_reviews.author: Braden Minaker

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is where has this been all my life!! Absolutely love it. Simple set up and everything works as promised. Multiple documents feed through very well, of course you can't overload as it is a small device.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. After reading all the positive reviews and seeing that it was an Amazon's choice , I figured this was a no-brainer. I had to scan in over 100 receipts and my HP scanner was too slow to get the job done. The scan quality of this device is excellent but..... The Wi-Fi would disconnect after a few minutes of idle time and you would have to repeat the setup all over again! On the last try I couldn't even get it to connect !!! Back in the box it goes.
customer_reviews.author: David Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, but lacking
customer_reviews.text: First off, no android app. How does a company ignore the larger Android user base? Secondly it has an ass backwards wifi approach. The unit creates a wifi connection. So you have to jump off your wifi to connect to it. Scans were fine, nothing special. I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Terry R.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to use. Unreliable and does not work when you need it most Update: Great customer service Device still doesn’t connect to my laptop and the SD card is now corrupted. I’m giving it 3 stars because of the friendly and helpful customer service but a scanner that’s close to $300 should work pretty damn well. As a busy professional it’s hard to spend time away from work to figure out how to get a scanner to work.
customer_reviews.author: C. Rangel

customer_reviews.title: well made, weird way to manage documents
customer_reviews.text: First off, this scanner works fine and is well made. Only gripe about the physical device is it seems to take a long time (minutes) to actually connect to wifi after being started up. Main issue for me was software. There is no direct way to scan into any software other than the doxie software. You can then move the files into a limited set of other software and online services. I have returned this and will get a twain compliant scanner so I can scan directly into my document software.
customer_reviews.author: veevsato

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but could be better
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done but isn't that easy to use. If scanning multiple pages it quite often pulls in more than one page causing you to have to start over or scan one page at a time. I would probably go with a different brand next time. It also scans white paper as a gray.
customer_reviews.author: ASF

customer_reviews.title: Documents Must be Placed into Scaner Facedown for a Good Scan
customer_reviews.text: The Doxie Q makes excellent scans of documents, my only gripe is that the Doxie Q does not scan documents from the top facing down so when I scanned about thirty letters feeding the documents into the scanner face up I got excellent scans of the back side of the sheets of paper the letters were written on, I am still getting use to feeding documents into the Doxie Q in a facedown ordination. Attached is a copy of a letter I scanned using the Doxie Q.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick C. Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Great little scanner for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great little scanner for the price. It's a bit annoying that you can't scan while it's connected to the computer without it disconnecting from the file system, but not a deal breaker. I like that I can scan stand-alone and connect up later. The app is a bit of a pain in the rear to work with, but really a non-issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Scans & Support
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to digitize tons of family photos, many from the early 1900's. It works great, and I love that I can sit and watch TV and just feed photo after photo into the scanner and it just does it, and puts them into an easy to find file. I had a couple of questions and the support team got back to me immediately, and then followed up with me a few days later. Did not expect personalized service like that!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: Battery would not hold a charge, could not scan more than 1 piece of paper at a time, connected occasionally to WiFi. Ended up throwing in the garbage. Huge waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: luisjms

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been hiding?
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased portable scanners before that could not come close to this little, lightweight gem’s performance. I have been using this since out of our house with the Nor Cal fires for the past few months. What a lifesaver! The customer support is truly excellent and very responsive. Thank you! I purchased through Amazon a ‘hard EVA protective case’ and 2 dense foam blocks (Pelican 1042 Foam Set) to further custom the inside. Great addition to the DoxieQ.
customer_reviews.author: Beauty Mark

customer_reviews.title: great company, good product
customer_reviews.text: first Doxie Q I got through Amazon had a problem. Called the company and they quickly got me a replacement. now it works great. I copied several piles of paper(approx. 300 pages) now off my desk and fully searchable. Highly recommended if you do genealogy and have many pages of research, now easily searchable in seconds.
customer_reviews.author: George Due

customer_reviews.title: It just works - OCR especially
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It scans accurately, and without a lot of fidgeting. The OCR is excellent. It is really slow, I will say, but I don't care because the OCR and the software are really convenient and more than make up for it. So glad I chose this over competing scanners. I'm going to put my Neat in the good will -- this is about 100 times better.
customer_reviews.author: Kari Matthews

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS SCANNER
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is horrible!!!!!!!! (1) It turns itself off every couple of minutes (2) Scans are always crooked (3) It jams more often than not (5) if you try to load the tray with multiple pages, it pulls them all through at once (6) It disconnects itself from the computer, when using a USB cable
customer_reviews.author: Hub Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Impressive speed
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up and so fast, it's fun to use. I'm systematically going paperless and this scanner puts my old model to shame. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: She Loves Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Good utility vehicle
customer_reviews.text: Good utility vehicle. I keep it within easy reach on my desk. quite useful for scanning photographs into my computer for safekeeping and future use.
customer_reviews.author: Stretch

customer_reviews.title: Compact and does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Very compact and easier to use than I expected. The mac software is excellent. You can adjust the DPI and scan type to make some pretty efficiently sized files. Key tool to going paperless.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Jones

customer_reviews.title: Fast, high quality scans, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Doxie Q is really easy to use, it’s fast and does an incredibly good scanning of not just texts but also images ( just scanned some drawings my children made years ago). It’s easy to transfer to my Imac and change the format , staple documents together to one document etc. And even better it takes up hardly any space as I keep it in a small drawer. In addition the customer service from Doxie is outstanding reaching out to make sure you are happy or if you need any help. With the help of Doxie Q I think finally I will be able to go paperless!
customer_reviews.author: AstridHP

customer_reviews.title: Great portable scanner, works with iOS.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for document and photo scanning. It works great and very portable. The only thing that would make it better would be if it scanned both sides of a document. It does have a "staple" function that allows documents to be turned over and scanned, and the end result is the same.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expensive brick, unresponsive support
customer_reviews.text: Item turns on, does not scan. Customer service unresponsive despite multiple attempts.
customer_reviews.author: Jenkintown family

customer_reviews.title: Portable scanner
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little scanner. It makes copies of several pages at a time. Software makes it easy to combine and send pages as pdf or jpeg. Image quality is quite good. Easy to carry around in a large tote or computer bag.
customer_reviews.author: Azyril

customer_reviews.title: Quality portable scanner
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this scanner wanting to go paperless. It did the job of scanning everything in my filing cabinet. Also scanned a number of pictures with great results. The small size makes it easy to move around with you with great battery life. The supporting software is also easy to use and makes uploading very easy. I opted to setup the wireless uploading feature which makes brining the documents onto my computer a breeze. Very happy with the Doxie so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Diehm

customer_reviews.title: Great portable scanner
customer_reviews.text: Well made device with stellar performance and a great set of instructions excellent online support
customer_reviews.author: Boris Clemens

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Works great with Evernote. the "staple" feature is great and easily improves Evernote efficiency for me. The only disappointment I have is the time it takes to connect to my WiFi; about 50 seconds and sometimes I get a partial page which I can easily scan again. .Now I look for items to load into Evernote. In the past I had to decide if it was worth adding an item or not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Set up problems
customer_reviews.text: I could not get this scanner to work properly. Perhaps it was due to my lack of technical ability! The company was very classy (an extra star) in that it refunded my money and let me keep the scanner. I gave it away and have no idea if the recipient got it working properly.
customer_reviews.author: acorn21

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product & Outstanding Service Support
customer_reviews.text: Everything in the Doxy box is labeled. There is not much thinking needed. They explain every step very well and the service is some of the best I have seen for any product of this type or cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this little scanner it is SO easy to use ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this little scanner it is SO easy to use and light weight. I take it everywhere with me. It is compact and it handles multiple pages. Also, the software is incredible. I used to use a different "stapling" software that cost $200. So, I am saving money and the scans are high quality and the customer service is fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: AccrualCat

customer_reviews.title: Don't live without this!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, super helpful in keeping documents organized and converted to PDF.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Useless device if you want to scan multiple pages
customer_reviews.text: Like - portability Dislike ... ADF absolutely useless , can scan no more than 2 pages. Clumsy mode settings, need to press mode button multiple times before getting correct mode Scanned docs are not always clear ... have thrown the unit away !!
customer_reviews.author: George Austin

customer_reviews.title: The customer service from this company is amazing. My scanner was not scanning correctly and they ...
customer_reviews.text: The customer service from this company is amazing. My scanner was not scanning correctly and they sent me a new one after I left a disappointed review. This is my second Doxie scanner. I upgraded from the Doxie Go Plus assuming that the multiple pages and wifi would be worth the upgraded price. After receiving the new scanner, it did fulfill all my needs and is easy to use and set up. The personal customer service is definitely a huge plus.
customer_reviews.author: Sondra E. Puorro

customer_reviews.title: Neat, Tidy, Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Very tidy, so far dependable. Fits on the desktop easily and within reach. I like its method of creating its own wifi to transfer docs to the computer.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Martini

customer_reviews.title: Easy to scan multiple pictures and documents quickly.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to quickly scan photos - works excellently! Super easy. Use the protective sleeve for fragile items. I have not yet tried the OCR for documents. This is a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Carlton T Lack

customer_reviews.title: Such a great, portable
customer_reviews.text: Such a great, portable, scanner. Doesn't scan a bunch of pages at one, because of the nice compact size, but it does allow you to "staple" pages together to create one document with ease. The customer service team has been great for the few questions I've had with it. I really like this scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic products and service. Best scanner for the money
customer_reviews.text: I love this scanner. Fast. Accurate. Easy to transfer via WiFi. I use to help go paperless. I store pictures, documents, etc. there isn’t any software so you will have to come up with a way to organize that works for you.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Doxie sent replacment and with software upgrade the unit is working great. It's amazing how much you can pack into ...
customer_reviews.text: Update. Doxie sent replacment and with software upgrade the unit is working great. It's amazing how much you can pack into one little device. Not a perfect solution but quite close. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Soto

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Assistance
customer_reviews.text: It is refreshing to have a company follow up with their customers in the manner which Doxie does. It is appreciated and lasting. I will highly recommend Doxie and their products. Best regards, John
customer_reviews.author: JJB

customer_reviews.title: Works great for digitizing the photos
customer_reviews.text: I really like this scanner. Worked really great for digitizing my old photos. I also like the software that makes importing the files easier.
customer_reviews.author: I. Yarmak

customer_reviews.title: Doxies customer service is exceptional
customer_reviews.text: The scanner works as advertised. The initial unit failed to work after a short period of time but Doxie reached out and made sure the defective unit was replaced in a timely manner. Props for Doxies customer service.
customer_reviews.author: C. Neilson

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. Portable, Fast, Clear scanning. This scanner helped me reduce all my paper clutter and photos. This scanner should be used by all to help minimize paper and photo clutter. Now I have all important papers in pdf files, and photos are stored in my digital photo frames thanks to this scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Luciano

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner. Just wish the software would be a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner. Just wish the software would be a little more advanced with the option of sorting out the types of docs being scanned into separate folders; which one have to do manually. Besides that, definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Symon Bowen

customer_reviews.title: You need this. Get rid of albums.
customer_reviews.text: I love the Doxie Q. The software is beyond easy to use. I had a previous version, the first wifi enabled one. My wife's aunt loved it so much, we gave it to her, and bought the Q. Love the paper feeder, and it still does pics very well, especially with the picture guide.
customer_reviews.author: Trance

customer_reviews.title: I've really enjoyed the ease of this scanner
customer_reviews.text: I've really enjoyed the ease of this scanner! It is easy to travel with, long battery life and instantly works with my lap top. And it fits anywhere! I love the ability to "staple" multiple scanned documents together as well. Wonderful portable scanner!
customer_reviews.author: really fun

customer_reviews.title: I love this scanner
customer_reviews.text: I love this scanner. It’s small enough to fit in a drawer. I’ve used it to go paperless. It’s quick and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: Will not feed more than two sheets
customer_reviews.text: This product will not automatically feed more than two sheets. Complete waste of money and time for what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: JhnJ

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing
customer_reviews.text: Took some getting used to but i was able to digatalize a few thousand Polaroids in a few hours
customer_reviews.author: Kyliak

customer_reviews.title: Best home or small office scanner for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Doxie scanner I purchased. Scans up to 10-12 pages fast with auto document feeder. No need to connect to your computer with wires, connects with Bluetooth wirelessly. Software is great. A great inexpensive scanner but durable if you want to go paperless. Can scan to PDF, and upload to Google Drive.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: Organize Your LIfe
customer_reviews.text: We used our scanner to scan over 2,000 photos. After we backed up the photos we dumped the hard copies. This saved us a lot of space. We have scanned hundreds of other documents also. Great way to get organized and save space.
customer_reviews.author: se

customer_reviews.title: Love this! My office is completely paperless now
customer_reviews.text: Love this! My office is completely paperless now. Scan my receipts etc. and store. Shred the receipts for recycling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just works! No error messages!
customer_reviews.text: Doxie Q: OCR option, ADF, compact footprint and so very user-friendly for this senior citizen. Step-by-step documentation was well-written and most importantly everything just worked well the very first time. No error messages! Plays well with my 2017 MacBook Pro! Just one minor issue: I was not able to keep the WiFi connected, but the cable works easily and consistently. And one huge positive: customer service immediately sent a replacement after I noted on their survey that the power on/off switch might have a problem. Yes, I am one (very) happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: DoxieQ User

customer_reviews.title: Almost a Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Convenient, but doesn’t feed as well as I hoped. Multi page scanning jams pretty much every time. The app could use some work - would be nice to have a more seamless file naming approach or a way to otherwise quickly categorize scans. All in all a decent step toward reducing paper clutter.
customer_reviews.author: big_mish

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Device is small, scans quickly. Multiple options for file transfer. Customer Service is awesome. Very responsive.
customer_reviews.author: B1800

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our home business
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our home business. Portable, small and works well. Took a little while to figure out how to use it correctly but now we love it and use it daily. Battery life is fantastic!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Brown

customer_reviews.title: Scans quickly and software works well. My only gripe ...
customer_reviews.text: Scans quickly and software works well. My only gripe is that receipts often jam when scanning. They include a sleeve for scanning delicate items. However, this makes it a cumbersome process.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia B.

customer_reviews.title: Versatile scanner that is small and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: It took me a little while to get used to how the wifi connection worked which is different from other apps I have used. I sent an email to support and received an answer to my question very quickly. I have been very impressed with the product and the service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An unimpressive product.
customer_reviews.text: The feeding mechanism did not work well and often multiple documents went through at the same time. Also, support is odd requiring me to email a question and then wait for a return email to answer my question. The scanner broke down 14 months after I purchased it. I ended up purchasing a Fujitsu Scan Snap which is a little more costly, but a waaaaaay better product. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: tireless

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: A little slow and can get misaligned but scans. Easier than a large clunky printer all in one
customer_reviews.author: TheScotts

product_meta.title: Doxie Q - Wireless Rechargeable A4 Document Scanner With Automatic Document Feeder
feature_bullets: 【Automatic, Rechargeable, and Truly Portable】Doxie Q is the automatic document scanner reinvented for true mobility to let you scan anywhere — no computer required — with a rechargeable battery, collapsible automatic document feeder, included memory, integrated Wi-Fi, and included Mac, PC, and iOS apps. Doxie's small size makes it easy to tuck it in your bag or a drawer when you're done scanning.

【Always Simple】Engineered for ultimate simplicity, Doxie just works — no special drivers needed — simply flip Doxie open, insert your paper, and hit scan. Doxie's automatic paper feeder receipts, cards, and fragile items.scans stacks of up to 8 full colour pages at once at up to 600 dpi. Or, use Doxie's direct feed slot to scan all your photos, receipts, cards, and fragile items.

【Amazing Software and OCR】Doxie makes it easy (and fun!) to go paperless. Doxie's included Mac and PC apps let you sync scans via USB or Wi-Fi to your desktop to organise and create searchable multi-page PDFs with award-winning ABBYY OCR technology. Save scans to your desktop, local apps, or your favourite cloud services — like Dropbox, Evernote, OneNote, and iCloud Drive. Or, sync scans to your iPhone or iPad with Doxie's iOS app to save and share your scans wherever you are.

【Satisfaction Guaranteed】Doxie Customer Care is always here to help you scan, organise, or just provide tips on the best ways to scan your paper. We guarantee you'll love your new Doxie as much as we loved building it, and back our products with a 1-year warranty and the best support in the scanner industry. Contact us anytime – hello@getdoxie.com
